intro: Silene kucukodukii, commonly known as the small Odoukii campion, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soil. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. Silene kucukodukii is a rare and endemic species, often found in specific regions of the Taurus Mountains.
